psi

Class PsiClientKeyDescriptionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • psi.PsiClientKeyDescriptionFactory

  • public class PsiClientKeyDescriptionFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates a PsiClientKeyDescription depending on the selected PsiClient implementation, requesting only the variables to be initialized.

    • Method Summary

      Builds a generic PsiClientKeyDescription that can be used to initialize a PsiClient which is compliant with either the BS, DH, ECBS or ECDH algorithm.

                                                                   java.lang.String modulus)
        Builds a PsiClientKeyDescription that can be used to initialize a PsiClient for the BS algorithm
        Parameters:
        serverPublicExponent - String representing the exponent of the server public key
        modulus - String representing the modulus of the key
        Returns:
        the PsiClientKeyDescription built based on the input parameters

      • createGenericPsiClientKeyDescription

        public static PsiClientKeyDescription createGenericPsiClientKeyDescription(java.lang.String clientPrivateExponent,
                                                                           java.lang.String serverPublicExponent,
                                                                           java.lang.String modulus,
                                                                           java.lang.String ecClientPrivateD,
                                                                           java.lang.String ecServerPublicQ)
                                                                    throws psi.exception.InvalidPsiClientKeyDescriptionException
        Builds a generic PsiClientKeyDescription that can be used to initialize a PsiClient which is compliant with either the BS, DH, ECBS or ECDH algorithm. Differently to other methods of this class, this method receives all the possible input parameter and checks whether it could be valid for any of the supported algorithms,
        Parameters:
        clientPrivateExponent - String representing the exponent of the client private key
        serverPublicExponent - String representing the exponent of the server public key
        modulus - String representing the modulus of the key
        ecClientPrivateD - the D parameter of the client private key
        ecServerPublicQ - the Q parameter of the server public key
        Returns:
        the PsiClientKeyDescription built based on the input parameters
        Throws:
        psi.exception.InvalidPsiClientKeyDescriptionException - whenever the input is not compliant to any PsiClientKeyDescription parameter combination
